newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan buys 50,000 tonnes of Indian sugar.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan buys 50,000 tonnes of Indian sugar.

text.p: The state-run Trading Corporation of Pakistan (TCP) said on Tuesday it had bought 50,000 tonnes of Indian sugar at $389 per tonne C&F for delivery by September 30.
A TCP official said the corporation had received three valid bids in response to its August 26 tender. Nine other bidders failed to make two percent advance security deposits.
The Indian sugar is to be shipped to the southern port of Karachi, the official added.

The TCP has bought 250,000 tonnes of sugar so far this fiscal year (July-June) to offset a shortfall in domestic output, which fell to 2.47 million tonnes in 1995/96 from three million in 1994/95, the official said.
